dublin_core.dcvalue: The goal of the concept and of the device presented in this contribution is to be able to collect sensor data from wearable sensors directly automatically and wirelessly and to make them available over a wired local area network Several concepts in e health and telemedicine make use of portable and wearable sensors to collect movement or activity data Usually these data are either collected via a wireless personal area network or using a connection to the user s smartphone However users might not carry smartphones on them while inside a residential building such as a nursing home or a hospital but also within their home Also in such areas the use of other wireless communication technologies might be limited The presented system is an embedded server which can be deployed in several rooms in order to ensure live data collection in bigger buildings Also the collection of data batches recorded out of range as soon as a connection is established is also possible Both the system concept and the realization are presented

Collecting and distributing wearable sensor data: an embedded personal area network to local area network gateway server.
